author: Staff Reporter
text:
Officials have been directed to make arrangements to provide basic amenities to thousands of devotees who are expected to visit the Mandaicaud Bhagavathy Amman Temple for the 10-day Masi festival from February 28.

Presiding over a preparatory meeting at the Collectorate here on Saturday, Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan asked the officials to ensure toilet and drinking water facilities and establish temporary bus shelters. Fire and Rescue Services department was asked to make arrangements to meet any eventuality.

The Masi festival would come to end with ‘odukku puja’ to be performed at midnight. Thousands of devotees from various parts of the State and neighbouring Kerala, carrying ‘irumudikattu,’ used to take part in the festival, called ‘Mandaicaud Kodai.’

The Collector asked the officials concerned to desilt the temple tank and police officials were instructed to set up CCTVs at to keep tabs on anti-social elements.

For the benefit of devotees wanting to take a holy dip in the Arabian Sea, steps would be taken to ensure safety, he said. Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation was asked to operate special buses from different parts of Kanyakumari district.
title: Temple festival: meet discusses arrangements
